meanings.definition: A white, crystalline solid fat found in palm oil and coconut oil.
meanings.sent1: The palmitin in the palm oil gives it a solid texture.
meanings.sent2: Coconut oil contains palmitin, which contributes to its creamy consistency.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled palmitin all over the kitchen, creating a slippery mess.
meanings.sent4: Her skin felt as smooth as palmitin, gliding effortlessly against the fabric.
meanings.sent5: The palmitin shimmered in the sunlight, resembling tiny crystals of snow.

meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the structure of palmitin under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: Palmitin is commonly used in the production of soaps and candles.
meanings.sent3: The children mistook the palmitin for sugar and tried to taste it, only to realize it was not sweet at all.
meanings.sent4: The palmitin acted as a protective shield, guarding the delicate ingredients within.
meanings.sent5: The artist molded the palmitin into intricate shapes, creating beautiful sculptures.
